Based on the user's preference cues and the provided movie list, I would recommend the following two movies:

1. Hitch (2005) directed by Robert Zemeckis. The story revolves around Alfred Hitchcock and François Truffaut meeting in the year 1986. The movie features a star-studded cast including Tom Hanks, Richard Jenkins, and Emily Blunt. The movie is based on real events and captures the essence of Hitchcock's character and his iconic style.

2. Monsters, Inc. (2001) directed by Pete Docter and Jeff Byrne. The story revolves around top scientists who work feverishly in a secret state-of-the-art laboratory to discover what killed the citizens of a small town and how the deadly contagion can be stopped. The movie features an all-star cast including John Malkovich, Billy Crystal, and Michael J Fox. The movie is based on real events and captures the essence of top scientists working feverishly in a secret state-of-the-art laboratory to discover what killed the citizens of a small town and how the deadly contagion can be stopped.

1) Lady in the Water (2006)
   This movie follows the story of a building superintendent who saves what he thinks is a young woman from the pool he maintains. Based on the user preference cues, I would recommend "Madame Bovary" to them.
This novel by Gustave Flaubert was first published in 1857 and tells the story of a wealthy woman named Emma Bovary who falls in love with a young man named Charles Langdon and eventually decides to leave her husband and go with Langdon, but ultimately she is unable to come to terms with her own desires and ends up destroying herself.
